title: Kelsey Fitzsimmons alleges former fiancé broke into her home, stole evidence while she was hospitalized
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Kelsey Fitzsimmons alleges her former fiancé broke into her North Andover home while she was hospitalized, stealing personal items.
The fiancé allegedly impersonated Fitzsimmons to access various accounts, withdrawing $5,000 and altering her financial records.
Essex County District Attorney's office has declined to charge the fiancé; Fitzsimmons claims lack of prosecutorial action is leniency.

title: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic while vacationing in Hawaii
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye led a free football clinic in Kealakekua, Hawaii, during his vacation.
The clinic, organized with Rich Miano and SAP, hosted 50 high school quarterbacks and receivers.
Maye instructed participants in drills, aiding QB footwork and throwing mechanics, and assisting receivers with route trees.

title: How well do you know Matt Damon and Ben Affleck? Take this quiz to find out.
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Boston.com released a quiz on Matt Damon and Ben Affleck's 40-year friendship, highlighting their origins in Cambridge.
The quiz takes inspiration from a GQ Magazine video where Damon and Affleck quizzed each other about their lives.
The actors, known for 'Good Will Hunting', currently collaborate at their production company, Artists Equity.

title: Review & setlist: Conan Gray’s ‘Wishbone’ tour brought a coming-of-age story to TD Garden
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Conan Gray performed at TD Garden, promoting his fourth album 'Wishbone' during a themed concert
The four-act show featured Gray in various costumes, exploring heartbreak and growth
The setlist included hits like 'Heather' and 'Maniac', closing with 'Vodka Cranberry' and an encore

title: 8 hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on Cape Cod
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eight people were hospitalized after carbon monoxide poisoning on a boat at MacMillan Pier in Provincetown.
The incident, with two found unresponsive, led to a mass-casualty declaration due to limited ambulance availability.
The ongoing power outages from a blizzard complicated the emergency response efforts in Provincetown.

title: Topsfield massage parlor shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Topsfield police shut down FeiFei L Spa on Boston Street over alleged prostitution and human trafficking.
The investigation involved collaboration between multiple agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security and Massachusetts State Police.
Police issued a cease-and-desist order; criminal charges are pending as the investigation continues.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Blue Jackets, facing the Bruins where he spent parts of seven seasons.
Coyle, a key player for Columbus, has 42 points in 57 games this season under coach Rick Bowness.
Coyle received a tribute from the Bruins and expressed gratitude for his tenure in Boston during his first game back.

title: Amid trying year, Olympic gold shone even brighter for Charlie McAvoy and his family
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy celebrated winning Olympic gold with Team USA, sharing a memorable moment with family in Milan.
McAvoy faced a difficult year, overcoming injuries and personal challenges, including a health scare with his son.
McAvoy excelled defensively during the Olympics, logging the second-most ice time for Team USA and helping secure victory.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of current events in Greater Boston.
Peter Chianca, a seasoned journalist, has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
The quiz aims to keep Boston residents informed on trending local stories and events.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro played 6 minutes as backup goalie for the Boston Bruins after Joonas Korpisalo's injury scare.
Korpisalo returned to complete the game, stopping 36 of 38 shots in the Bruins' 4-2 win over Columbus.
DiPietro, recalled from Providence, has a 22-6-0 record and a .938 save percentage in the AHL this season.
